website_summaries.verdict: The Mizuno Wave Rider 22 was well-received. This update to the long-running series of neutral shoes was deemed worthy of the Rider name, mainly when it came to its general quality and efficacy on the roads. People loved the visual design, the agreeable fit profile, and the sturdy build of this footwear. Inversely, some structural elements of the shoe were criticized for its weight, small toe box, and uncomfortable overlays. Overall, the Wave Rider 22 is deemed to be a remarkable running shoe with reliable functionalities.
pros: People were generally happy with the aesthetics of the Mizuno Wave Rider 22, stating that the colors and design were visually appealing
The underfoot cushioning system was considered to be very comfortable, some consumers noted
The width profiles of both the men and women’s versions accommodated medium-sized feet, based on a handful of reviews
Several purchasers commented that the general durability of the components was dependable
The gripping capability of the outsole was sure and precise, according to a couple of runners
A lot of reviewers agree the Wave Rider 22 is a supportive shoe
cons: The toe box of the Wave Rider 22 is not roomy enough for some of its users
A couple of wearers feel the shoe is bulky, especially because of the puffy-looking collar
The overlays on the upper tended to press into the fabric and cause irritation to the foot, some testers reported

customer_reviews.title: Great support and cushion
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing Brooks' Ghost line for several years; trying other brands every once in a while, but always going back to Brooks. I stumbled upon Mizuno's Wave Rider on RunRepeat.com. These shoes are fantastic! They are similar to the Brooks Ghost, however they are a bit lighter and there is more cushion in the heel. Additionally, they have a better fit, more snug. I noticed they do a run a tad smaller than Ghost. I wear a 9 1/2 in the Brooks and ordered a 9 1/2 for this pair. One may notice a little less room in the toe box area.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Best. Running shoes. Ever.
customer_reviews.text: Running is a lot easier with these! I have been a long time wave rider fan, the 22 is a great improvement! If you are looking for a very comfortable and cushy running shoe for sprints, long distance or off road training look no further, just do yourself a favor and buy a pair now!
customer_reviews.author: Cody Haas

customer_reviews.title: Width too narrow
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased three pairs of the previous versions of this shoe (I have two Mizuno Wave Rider 20's, and one Mizuno Wave Rider 21). This shoe (Mizuno Wave Rider 22) was between 1/4 inch and 1/2 inch more narrow than the three others (measured the width of the bottom of the shoe). There is no indication on the box, or the shoe, as to the width, but the product description states a "D" width, so I assume it's a "D". I will need to return these shoes, as they are too narrow for me - and perhaps have to shop for a new brand of shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Never buying Nike running shoes again
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of Wave Riders first was the 19, I wore them out bought Nikes to get by big mistake just not the same. I just finished a few 5Ks in this one and they are so comfortable. The last wave rider did a half marathon numerous 5Ks and training.
customer_reviews.author: Norman Davis

customer_reviews.title: Still a very good shoe
customer_reviews.text: I have been running in wav riders for a few years. I am always worried when they come out with the next version. They kept true to the design. They still fit well and make for a good running shoe. I have found I replace them a little more often than other shoes I have used.
customer_reviews.author: Peter K.

customer_reviews.title: Consistent quality and fit
customer_reviews.text: This is my fourth pair of Mizuno Wave Riders. I had the meniscus in my left knee removed when I was younger, and these shoes allow me to keep running without my knee reminding me of my past. Knowing my size and Mizuno's product consistency took the guesswork and anxiety out of ordering on-line.
customer_reviews.author: Jenrey

customer_reviews.title: Best running shoes I have ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: I use to wear Brooks GTS shoes. They were a good shoe but they just didn't last. The soles would fall apart. So I tried Mizuno Wave Rider. They feel better to run in and feel well made. They have already out lasted my last pair if Brooks.
customer_reviews.author: muenchen25

customer_reviews.title: Nice updates
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing Waveriders for about three years and these are consistent with the line. These are a little softer than the previous two models that I have tried and I very much appreciate that as I am using them for training for and running marathons.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: I have several Paris of Mizuno shoes there my brand of choice for athletic shoes now. I wear this to take you there pair to work I'm on my feet away from 8 to 10 hours a day these are great best shoes I've ever had a was a long time Nike where but I'm done with that company now it's Mizuno from now on. I also run in these shoes as well as some of the other types of Mizuno running shoes can't go wrong with this company.
customer_reviews.author: Tony M. Kees

customer_reviews.title: Can't find walking shoes anymore that meet my requirements
customer_reviews.text: These may be OK for me, which is saying a lot. It has been almost impossible for me to find an acceptable replacement for the old NB 928, my forever walking shoe, that New Balance started making in foreign countries and they were never as good since then. These Wave Riders seem very comfy and cushiony and fit well. I'll see. If they continue to please, I'll order a couple more pairs to have when Mizuno does what New Balance did. Seems every time I find some article of clothing I really love, I can never replace it after it wears out.
customer_reviews.author: Roger R.

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: My husband is a custodian and Mizunos are the only shoes he will wear.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shoes, fit exactly as expected
customer_reviews.text: Was worried they wouldn't be the same as you'd get from Mizuno, but they are the exact same shoe seen on the Mizuno website for the Wave Rider 22's! I love them, and they fit perfectly. So glad I could order these online, as the store here that sells them only had the ugly colors and I really wanted the black/gold ones! Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Marklar

customer_reviews.title: They wear like iron
customer_reviews.text: I am on my second pair of the Wave Rider 22's and find them to significantly outlast any others I have tried. I am not a typical distance runner in that I am 6'3" and 200 pounds. These shoes last up to around 315 miles before I retire them. My Hoka's wore out in 125 miles and Brooks, while a little better, still wore out far sooner than these. There is not very much cushion in them, so be prepared for a little extra pounding. Great shoes!
customer_reviews.author: Forensic Guy

customer_reviews.title: Finally went to Mizunos
customer_reviews.text: Finally went to Mizunos after years of hearing about them from a race director friend of mine. I'm a light sneaker type of guy and these are definitely light. But the comfort makes up for that. I find so many sneakers like Brooks to be heavy without being overly comfortable but these make you forget about the weight because of their thick heel support and support around the front of your foot. Ran 16 miles the other day with them and my feet felt and looked great. Bought a second pair after running a couple of great weeks with them.
customer_reviews.author: Scot S

customer_reviews.title: Nice cushion
customer_reviews.text: I run couple of times a week 3-5 miles each time. I am much of a heel striker and considering that I have knee problems, this shoe handled my runnings pretty well. I used to have ASICS but I needed a wide one so I went and bought these. I compared these pairs with New balance v1080 and I thought I couldn’t go wrong with either choice. I am, in fact, considering getting another pair and I would probably get the new balance so I can switch between these two. Certainly would recommend
customer_reviews.author: SM

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great Mizuno Shoes! I am loving these shoes because they are so comfortable, look nice, and give great support!
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: I keep coming back to these -- but one minor flaw
customer_reviews.text: I love mizuno's. Especially wave riders. This is probably my 4th or 5th pair. Tried going to Brook's, Saucony, Asics, but keep coming back. Just bought the Knit R2's to replace this pair. My only complaint for this last pair of 22's -- the stitching of the logo on the upper would chafe on long runs causing blisters. I'm chalking that up to a random manufacturing anomaly. It was only on one foot and I never had it on earlier versions. The Knits have the logo painted on which eliminates that possibility. Mizuno should consider that for all shoes, it'll probably cost them less and reduce weight anyway. But that's just my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: More like Borophyll

customer_reviews.title: too narrow in the heel / poor fitting insoles
customer_reviews.text: The shoes are lightweight and provide good cushioning. I ordered the "true size" and found them to be ok lengthwise. That said, wearing the shoes still resulted in blisters appearing all around the bottom and edge of the heel area. Perhaps the insoles aren't as well fitting as they should be. Tried thinner socks, nothing helps. Won't wear and can't recommend.
customer_reviews.author: AM

customer_reviews.title: Another Winner from Mizuno
customer_reviews.text: I've had Mizuno Wave Rider shoes for many years, and this latest generation is another winner. Fits exactly as expected, lightweight, with just the right amount of cushioning. I run ~4 miles/run, for about two-to-three runs a week, and Wave Riders will usually last me 9 months to a year, until it's time for replacement.
customer_reviews.author: PaulF In OC

customer_reviews.title: Switched from Asics to Mizuno, and I do not regretted at all.
customer_reviews.text: Switched from Asics to Mizuno, and I do not regretted at all. I should have switched a long time ago. The shoes have lasted 500 miles of flat/hill running and still going (170 lbs). Sole and outer are of great quality and have incredible durability. The are lighter than what they look.
customer_reviews.author: Hadad

customer_reviews.title: Perfect balance of cushion and lightweight responsiveness
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been a Wave Rider fan since model 12. My gate is neutral to under pronation (supination) with high, fairly rigid arches, and this version, like all WR models I’ve worn, offers the perfect balance of cushion and responsiveness. The fit is perfect: not too snug but a nice “hug” with plenty of ventilation. If you’re on the heavy side and a neutral to under pronator, you might try the Sky Wave, which is more on the cushioned side but a great fit similar to the Wave Rider.
customer_reviews.author: Barton Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Wave Riders Great For Wide Feet
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of Wave Rider 22 size 9.5E shoes and they fit and run like they were designed specifically for me. I am a between 15-30 mile per week runner with a wide foot that is a mid foot striker. The Wave Rider 22s have given me both a comfortable and a cushioned ride without blisters or any of the tightness issues I have experienced with other running shoes. My first pair is still serviceable at about 325 miles while I am working my second pair into the rotation. I heartily recommend these if you have wide feet and need a well cushioned shoe for fitness running.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory James

customer_reviews.title: Still nice.
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing these for 3 generations or so now. My only complaint is that they don't last very long before they go flat. Maybe 6 months or so before my feet and legs start aching and I have to buy a new pair. But when they are new and tight, they feel great.
customer_reviews.author: Kat Vent

customer_reviews.title: extremely comfortable
customer_reviews.text: So I cross train now and I've not been much of a runner. The class has us running more since the weather is nicer and I keep tweaking my Achilles tendon that I have tendonitis in. Read that these running shoes are helpful. I can't tell you whether these are helping yet with the tendonitis but they sure are the most comfortable running shoe I've worn. I'll come back with an update in a month or so.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Like a custom designed shoe
customer_reviews.text: Cana shoe feel like it fits like a glove? I don’t want any other running shoe! I actually bought six of these.
customer_reviews.author: Turfy

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic padding and longevity in this shoe.
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th pair of Mizuno Wave Rider shoes. I am a big guy and am very demanding of my footwear and these shoes are among the very best for a fella who needs padding. ASIC gel Nimbuses are also a good option if plenty of padding is needed.
customer_reviews.author: Irene And Bobby

customer_reviews.title: White shoes
customer_reviews.text: I like the brand and like most you have to find the models that fit. The Wave runner 21 fits my 13 foot perfect. This Wave 22 feels a bit tighter toe and width, but will work. The color white is an extreme white but I use them for running only so I don't care about making a fashion statement.
customer_reviews.author: T nelly

customer_reviews.title: Truly the best
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable. Durable. I'm still racking up a lot of mileage and these are just as strong as if they were purchased yesterday. I'm so happy to have come across Mizuno, the quality is shockingly good. You can't go wrong with these. Highest possible recommendation.
customer_reviews.author: Cherith Cutestory

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: These with inserts literally cured my plantar facitisis. After reading other sites reviews I ordered these a year ago. Within days I was "cured". This is my second pair when I saw them on sale.
customer_reviews.author: Sundance

customer_reviews.title: Great durable and comfortable Waver Rider 22
customer_reviews.text: Just ordered my second pair. These probably have well over 500 miles on them and they are still solid. I wear a size 15 which is pretty hard to find, but these appear to be very easy to find.
customer_reviews.author: John H.

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable but made my feet feel like burning
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what happened but after about 2 miles my feet felt hot. I adjusted my socks (polyester), and adjusted the laces but still felt burning. For sure these would give me blisters eventually. Had to send them back!
customer_reviews.author: James Smith

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit and great comfort
customer_reviews.text: I run 20-30 miles a week, and out of all running shoes I have tried (Asics, Nike, Adidas etc.) these are hands down the best for my feet. I have somewhat wide feet, and the wide version is perfect fit. No squeeze on the toes or sides, great cooling and dries quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Kjetil "Chet"

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and supportive
customer_reviews.text: On my fifth pair of the Wave Rider series and find them to be supportive and comfortable for someone with a high instep. I use them for running at the gym and on natural surfaces and have found that they reduce knee pain due to proper support. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: ANDREW

customer_reviews.title: didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: I switched from Asics GT 2000 as the latest version of that shoe got bad reviews for wear. The Wave Riders felt OK at first but after a few runs I hurt my foot, and had to return them.
customer_reviews.author: tomd

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable running shoe
customer_reviews.text: Love my mizunos. It’s all I buy now for running. These are very light and comfortable and cause no issues for long runs on pavement. I’m 205lbs and there’s plenty of support and cushioning for me. I would recommend you try them out. They do run a half size smaller than the nikes I used to run with. My suggestion is to try them in a store for sizing then order online.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen E. Parker

customer_reviews.title: Pass on these cheap shoes
customer_reviews.text: I really love the bright blue color of the shoe! And I really wanted to like these shoes but they are way too tight and I wear a 13eeee. Look elsewhere for a better shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Bronze

customer_reviews.title: Fits well and is neutral
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these shoes as replacements for my Brooks. They're lighter and more neutral than my Brooks.
customer_reviews.author: flingylingy

customer_reviews.title: Ideal for all kinds of running
customer_reviews.text: Super comfortable, ideal for people with wide feet. Lightweight yet enough cushion too
customer_reviews.author: jeff goldberg

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly narrow but still comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This style fits very narrow, I'm a 13w and I bought a regular 14 as is usually the case. Very glad I went up to 14 as they are comfortable just not what I'm used to from Mizuno, my go to running shoe
customer_reviews.author: Tim N

customer_reviews.title: The shoe was used, dirt in the soles and ...
customer_reviews.text: The shoe was used, dirt in the soles and a wear pattern from whom ever had it and returned it already. Really, shoes......
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: This is a great running shoe
customer_reviews.text: Better than any NIKE running shoe I have ever bought. The durability and wear for a supinate runner like me is perfect. I ordered an extra pair in case they would discontinue it in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Heavily Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: These shoes were great, as Mizunos usually are....for about 1000 miles. Then the support on the right shoe totally gave out, and now when I try to run it twists my ankle to the right. I'll probably never buy another pair of Mizunos again. They've been by go to shoe for a decade or more, but after this? My posture has fallen to pieces and I have trouble with my sciatic nerve because these things destroyed my form.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin A

customer_reviews.title: Favorite
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe for runners. My husband has been using these for almost 20 years. He rotates between two pairs and tracks his mileage and then buys them again.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Schu

customer_reviews.title: Great improvement over wave 20
customer_reviews.text: I have been running with the wave 20 for a long time. They are sill good but i wanted to upgrade and indeed these are even more comfortable but mainly provide beeter bounce energy
customer_reviews.author: yair tzafri

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable running shoe I have owned!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned a lot of running shoes in my lifetime. I am also a caddie by profession and do a tremendous amount of walking. These are the best shoes I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: John Lewman

customer_reviews.title: perfect every time
customer_reviews.text: I have run in wave rider for YEARS and YEARS ... love them.. they have gotten too expensive so when I saw these priced in the 70s $ , I grabbed ... if anyone knows where to get them consistently cheaper, let me know ,...
customer_reviews.author: BeachMan

customer_reviews.title: Love my shoes
customer_reviews.text: I have another pair that are grey and I love them as running shoes. They fit great and support is fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Melrose

customer_reviews.title: Hurt me.
customer_reviews.text: Hurt my feet. Returned them. Didn’t want to write this review but every time I sign into amazon it’s wagging in my face.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy

customer_reviews.title: They have to be comfortable
customer_reviews.text: The footpad does not seem to fit my foot, I will put inserts in and that should make them tolerable. This is my first shoe from this manufacturer and I am not elated so far. I normally order Saucony which seem to fit me quite well. I have strayed from the path and I might be paying for it.
customer_reviews.author: Rich H

customer_reviews.title: good fit and feel for a neutral foot
customer_reviews.text: good for about 500-600 miles. on my 8th pair of wave riders
customer_reviews.author: W. Smith

customer_reviews.title: a great shoe but not durable
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the wave rider series for 5 years or so. Excellent shoes but they do not last long.
customer_reviews.author: J. Beghin

customer_reviews.title: Mizuno....The right choice
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes. My husband is flat footed and is in his feet most of the day. We always purchase these shoes. Very good support
customer_reviews.author: Joanie

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoe
customer_reviews.text: Amazingly comfortable and ends the long search for wide and comfort if you are a wide-footed runner. I have been with Mizuno for awhile now and love them. These are my latest, and they are great.
customer_reviews.author: RRM

customer_reviews.title: Puffy collar
customer_reviews.text: The padded ankle collar is way too big on these shoes. Adds unnecessary weight and bulkiness and the look of it is odd. Impacts my running because it’s difficult to tighten the laces for sufficient stability. Impossible to notice this puffiness in the photos. Much different from past Mizuno versions I’ve owned.
customer_reviews.author: JCDux

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Shoes
customer_reviews.text: I swear by MIzuno shoes. These did not disappoint. Comfortable and stylish. Good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: James D. Sherman

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoes, hold up well.
customer_reviews.text: I love these and are a great neutral running shoe. I am a personal trainer and on my feet all day and these are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Cornwell

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Wide size for wearing thicker socks during the winter time. These shoes are the best.
customer_reviews.author: bigc

customer_reviews.title: lightweight & comfortable & well-made
customer_reviews.text: but didn't have as much heel cushioning as I would like for heavy workouts on elliptical machines as well as running.
customer_reviews.author: Lenny

customer_reviews.title: Just as good as the previous generations
customer_reviews.text: Just as good as the previous generations. Principal differences the addition of mesh around the ankle Which makes the feeling a little bit more sock like
customer_reviews.author: easyg

customer_reviews.title: Best shoes ever!
customer_reviews.text: Lightest most comfortable running/ walking shoes I’ve ever had! Will definitely buy it again again!
customer_reviews.author: Alekhine Sabalo

customer_reviews.title: Among the very best for cushioning
customer_reviews.text: These shoes represent my 9th and 10th pairs of these shoes. I love the Mizuno Wave Riders because the cushion is second to none. I am a big guy and these shoes give me excellent cushioning throughout the day and they also have great longevity for a shoe that takes a lot of beating and wear. I recommend these for anyone that requires superior cushioning.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Fits like a glove
customer_reviews.text: I'm a huge Mizuno fan, they feel broken in the first time you wear them. My feet love em
customer_reviews.author: Edward Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: The only shoe I will wear!
customer_reviews.text: I am a huge fan of the Wave Rider! I have my everyday ones in wide size and my running days are normal width. Give them a try and get hooked.
customer_reviews.author: Brent T. Wingrath

customer_reviews.title: Great cushion and looks
customer_reviews.text: Loved these shoes! Arch support was great a cushioning lasted for several weeks. As an avid runner/walker this is important to me. Love these wheels!
customer_reviews.author: Michael n

customer_reviews.title: The only shoe I run in!
customer_reviews.text: I have been running in Mizuno Wave Riders since I began running a few years ago. The shoes have changed a bit over the years but they always work well for me. The only downside is the cost - you used to be able to find them on sale every now and then but deals are harder to come by now. Pick up a few pairs when you find a good deal!
customer_reviews.author: Mark J.

customer_reviews.title: Been wearing Mizuno since 2005 and this is an awesome shoe
customer_reviews.text: Good fit. Comfortable. As usual you throw away the shoe inserts and use your favorite brand. I have run 5 miles so far and feels great during the break-in period.
customer_reviews.author: ande

customer_reviews.title: Hurts My Arch
customer_reviews.text: This is a expensive shoe that hurts my arches. Going back to Asics.
customer_reviews.author: CoachM303

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable shoe
customer_reviews.text: The shoe feels comfortable and feels like a good quality shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Carlo Sciulli

customer_reviews.title: Great comfortable shoe that looks good too.
customer_reviews.text: Supports my feet very well and gives good support for my frame.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Mahoney

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfect and feels the exact same as the wave rider 21. Great shoe for trail running.
customer_reviews.author: andrew33433

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, great arch, comfortable run, breathes well.
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes. I just had to retired my old Mizuno Wave Riders after 300+ miles. Amazingly comfortable, perfect arch support, extremely light and well designed. I do not think I will ever go to another brand. Let's hope for another 300 or even more!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: Sole Broke Apart
customer_reviews.text: Sprinted for the first time in them. The sole ripped apart where the "Wave" portion is. Very comfortable shoes and true to the size, but will not last.
customer_reviews.author: Nolan Ono

customer_reviews.title: GREAT SHOES AT A GREAT PRICE!!!
customer_reviews.text: SEEMS THIS COLOR OF WAVE RIDER 22 HAS A SLIGHTLY WIDER TOE BOX THAN OTHER COLORS--?--THE BLUE/ORANGE COLOR WAS TOO NARROW FOR MY FOOT---THESE FIT PERFECT--GREAT ALL AROUND SHOE--LASTS FOR 400MILES--LIGHT WEIGHT--BUT HAS TONS OF CUSHIONING---NEW VERSION WILL HAVE TO GO SOME TO BEAT THESE
customer_reviews.author: billyp

customer_reviews.title: Dependable running shoe
customer_reviews.text: I've tried several brands and the Mizuno is both comfortable and durable.
customer_reviews.author: Zbd

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoes.
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing the Wave Rider's for many years and they get better and better. Would not think of getting anything else.
customer_reviews.author: NBL

customer_reviews.title: One of the beat shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfectly. The shoe is well-made and durable as always. Overall the shoe is of highest quality.
customer_reviews.author: tomons

customer_reviews.title: good cushion when running, experienced no knee pain.
customer_reviews.text: good shoe, better cushion than expected, experienced no knee pain thus far.
customer_reviews.author: C. Emery

customer_reviews.title: Worth the upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Been running in Mizuno for a lot of years. I used to run in the Wave Prophecy series but went down to these because they're lighter. I love these shoes as much as the 21's. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Best running shoe I’ve ever gotten
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been getting this model of running show for the past 12 years. Lasts long and comfortable. Great for those who get shin splints.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoes
customer_reviews.text: Great cushioning, stability and support. Nice change from Asics and Brooks.
customer_reviews.author: NJKC

customer_reviews.title: Only the left shoe
customer_reviews.text: I love mizuno shoes and was anticipating the arrival until I opened the box and found only the left shoe. Maybe the label under the shipping label stating the weigh was wrong should have clued someone in to the fact that something was wrong before shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Roy Belcher

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunate pressure point
customer_reviews.text: Nice overall quality and look. Unfortunately the structure of Mizuno logo on the outside of the shoe created a pressure point on the edge of the 5th metatarsal. The shoe stretched out with use a little bit but not enough to eliminate the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Summer training 2019
customer_reviews.text: I have been running in the Wave Rider 22 all summer. It is a lightweight high mileage training sneaker.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Great lighter, long-distance runners.
customer_reviews.text: Great fit & confort for several 5-10 mile runs taken since started using them five weeks ago. Very light, among the best comfort in any running shoe I've used & good return despite the cushy feel. True to size.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Hawley

customer_reviews.title: Too narrow
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed by the size 9, too narrow, previously owned WR 20 size 9 was perfect fit. I was able to realize that it is not a good fit only after a workout, so the seller would not accept a return if it was used even a single time, very upset.I am going to write a complaint to Mizuno, because it hurts my feet.
customer_reviews.author: YK

customer_reviews.title: Favorite shoe
customer_reviews.text: Favorite shoe. Gym rat who is at the gym 4 - 6 hours a day. Been through 4 or 5 generations of this shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Miller

customer_reviews.title: My feet loves Mizuno!!!
customer_reviews.text: Been wearing Mizuno for quite some time and my feet are loving them.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Ramos

customer_reviews.title: Good trainer
customer_reviews.text: Great training shoe that can be used for races. Better than the 20 version
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: I am an older runner who runs about 156 miles per week. These shoes are well custioned and get my needs perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: terry

customer_reviews.title: Feels like a foot glove
customer_reviews.text: But not too tight like a glove can be. This is an excellent shoe. Very comfortable....
customer_reviews.author: Keith Isaacson

customer_reviews.title: Good Looking Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Love the color combo. Coming from Brooks Beasts, the insole is not as padded. The shoe has great mix of being light and supportive.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t buy again
customer_reviews.text: Wore these out pretty quick. Not the most comfortable shoe
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My favorite running shoes
customer_reviews.text: The Wave Rider is the perfect combination of cushioning, support and comfort in a lightweight running shoe. I wear them on my daily runs and in races ranging from 5Ks to half marathons. I love the wide sizes.
customer_reviews.author: gerard

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great hoe, comfortable from the second I took them out of the box and put them on.
customer_reviews.author: Bert

customer_reviews.title: Would highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Paid more on other websites - Great product Bought these at recommendation from son and daughter l/ most comfortable shoes ever
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Keep coming back.
customer_reviews.text: About my 6th Mizuno Wave Rider pair and I’ve loved them all.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Run like Murakami
customer_reviews.text: 1st running shoes. I read people having problems with the size but I chose to order true to my foot size and it worked out perfectly. I am a heel striker and the blade technology really helps me in avoiding injuries.
customer_reviews.author: sounak

customer_reviews.title: Receives an orthotic well
customer_reviews.text: The shoe is quality as expected but could have used a little more arch support.
customer_reviews.author: D. F. BRADY

customer_reviews.title: good shoe ...
customer_reviews.text: I chose a 1/2 size too small and/or wide is not wide enough (for me); it is nice a snug fit during the work-out but I can't leave them on afterward or my feet start to get a little sore
customer_reviews.author: Mark C.

customer_reviews.title: Shoe runs small
customer_reviews.text: I’ve purchased many styles of Mizuno’s men’s shoes always in size 11 with perfect results. Unfortunately this style runs half size too small, had to exchange for an 11.5
customer_reviews.author: FAC

product_meta.title: Mizuno Men's Wave Rider 22 Running Shoe
product_meta.description: Wave rider 22 incorporates a 2-layered engineered mesh upper for excellent breathability and comfort. Cloud Wave cushioning technology has softened the runners experience, while maintaining a responsive ride.
feature_bullets: MIZUNO WAVE: Wave sets the standard for running shoe technologies.
This neutral favorite uses a parallel CLOUDWAVE for cushioning and shock attenuation.
Engineered Mesh Upper: Both breathable and durable for high performance.
INTERCOOL: Cool and dry. Offers great breathability. Ventilation system reduces heat and humidity build-up inside the shoe during performance.
